sourcing.instructions: Co: Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical retailers; Er: Chemical supply companies; Fe: Local metal suppliers or online; P: Chemical supply companies; Tm: Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical retailers.
steps: Co: Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical retailers; Er: Chemical supply companies; Fe: Local metal suppliers or online; P: Chemical supply companies; Tm: Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical retailers.

1. Weigh out the required amounts of each material using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, add Co, Er, Fe, P, and Tm in the specified order. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform color and consistency are achieved (approximately 10-15 minutes).
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out the required amounts of each material using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, add Co, Er, Fe, P, and Tm in the specified order. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform color and consistency are achieved (approximately 10-15 minutes).

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 1200°C. 3. Hold the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and phase formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 1200°C. 3. Hold the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and phase formation.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not remove the crucible until it has cooled completely to prevent cracking or warping of the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not remove the crucible until it has cooled completely to prevent cracking or warping of the material.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 in x 2 in x 7 in). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with progressively finer grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a suitable resin for durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 in x 2 in x 7 in). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with progressively finer grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a suitable resin for durability.
